channel.title: GUI Scroll Bars
channel.description: I need help adding a scroll bar to my GUI, anyone know how?

item.title: GUI Scroll Bars
item.dc:creator: @jungledude jungledude
item.description:
@jungledude wrote:

Because I plan on releasing and I want it in Noob language. Also

public void append(String addTextGUI) { String String = textArea.append(); } would not work l0lz!

public void addText(String addTextGUI) { textArea.append(addTextGUI + newline); } is more like it

I need help adding a Scroll bar to the GUI I’m using. I’ve tried everything I can think of but it dose not seem to work.

I get errors like

Compiling...
announcement.java:89: cannot find symbol
symbol  : variable scrollBar
location: class announcement
                frame.add(scrollBar, "East");
                          ^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
1 error
Complete!
Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.title: GUI Scroll Bars
item.dc:creator: @xxxxxx_13 xxxxxx 13
item.description:
@xxxxxx_13 wrote:

mmmk then. it was just an idea. i said im new to coding you dont have to poke fun

Read full topic

item.title: GUI Scroll Bars
item.dc:creator: @jungledude jungledude
item.description:
@jungledude wrote:

I see!!! It wasn’t supposed to be

announcement.append

it was supposed to be

server.announcement.append

I never declared announcement.java in my client.java only server. Thanks for the help.

[quote=“xxxxxx 13, post:9, topic:135107”]ok heres a noob prospective. Compiling... client.java:141: ';' expected String announcement.textArea.append() = ""+addTextGUI; ^ 1 error Complete! Press any key to continue . . .

ok it says expecting ; and it points to where you have a . how about trying to put a ; where the . is :P? idk just a thought and sometimes it can be like an extra space or something[/quote]

Are you stupid? That would fuck it all up. IT wants me to do that because it dose not know what

textArea.append() = ""+addTextGUI;

is…

Read full topic

item.description:
@pljay03 wrote:

Try replacing it with this:

public void addText(String addTextGUI) { String announcement.textArea = ""+addTextGUI.append(); }
